{{also|Appendix:Variations of "ja"}} ==English== ===Etymology 1=== Borrowed from {{bor|en|af|ja|t=yes}}, from {{der|en|nl|ja|t=yes}}. More at {{m|en|yeah}}. ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|ya}} ====Adverb==== {{en-adv|-}} # {{lb|en|chiefly|South Africa|informal}} [[yes]] =====Derived terms===== * {{l|en|ja well no fine}} ===Etymology 2=== From the [[Revised Romanization of Korean|Revised Romanization]] of {{bor|en|ko|Ïûê}} ====Alternative forms==== * {{l|en|cha}} ====Noun==== {{en-noun|s|ja}} # {{lb|en|Korean|_|units of measure}} {{syn of|en|Korean foot|nodot=a}}: a [[traditional]] [[unit of measure|unit]] of [[length]] [[equivalent]] to [[about]] 30.3{{nbsp}}[[cm]]. ===Anagrams=== * {{anagrams|en|a=aj|AJ}} [[Category:en:Units of measure]] ---- ==Afrikaans== ===Etymology=== From {{inh|af|nl|ja}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|af|/jaÀê/}} ===Adverb=== {{head|af|adverb}} # [[yes]] [[Category:Afrikaans phrasebook]] ---- ==Alemannic German== ===Alternative forms=== * {{alter|gsw|jaa|j√§}} ===Etymology=== From {{inh|gsw|goh|ja}}, {{m|goh|jƒÅ}}, from {{inh|gsw|gem-pro|*ja}}. Cognate with {{cog|nl|ja|t=yes}}, {{cog|en|yea|t=yes, yea}}, {{cog|la|iam|t=already}}. More at {{l|en|yes}}. ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|de|/jaÀê/}} * {{audio|de|De-ja.ogg|audio}} * {{audio|de|CPIDL German - Ja.ogg|Audio}} * {{rhymes|de|aÀê}} * {{homophone|de|Jahr}} {{a|according to a widespread pronunciation of this word}} ===Adverb=== {{de-adv}} # [[yes]] #: {{ux|de|Willst du das? '''Ja'''.|Do you want that? '''Yes'''.|inline=y}} #: {{ux|de|Aber '''ja'''!|'''Yes''', of course!|inline=y}} # {{lb|de|intensifier}} [[obviously]]; [[certainly]]; [[of course]]; [[really]]; [[just]]; as you know; as is generally known {{non-gloss definition|(indicates and emphasises that one is expressing a known fact)}} #: {{ux|de|Es kann '''ja''' nicht immer so bleiben.|It '''obviously''' cannot always remain so.|inline=y}} #: {{ux|de|Der Peter war '''ja''' gestern krank.|Peter was sick yesterday, as you know.|inline=y}} ====Usage notes==== * {{sense|yes}} {{m|de||Ja}} is used to indicate agreement with a positive statement. To contradict a negative statement (where English would use ‚Äúyes‚Äù), {{m|de|doch}} is used instead. * {{sense|obviously}} {{m|de||Ja}} means roughly the same as English ''obviously'' or ''as you know'', but given its shortness it is used much more frequently. In colloquial German, {{m|de||ja}} is used in most statements of facts already known to the one addressed. ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|yes}} {{l|de|jawohl}} * {{sense|obviously}} {{l|de|doch}}, {{l|de|bekanntlich}} ====Antonyms==== * {{l|de|nein}} ====Derived terms==== * {{l|de|bejahen}} * {{l|de|Ja}} * {{l|de|jein}} ===Interjection=== {{head|de|interjection}} # [[yes]] ====Synonyms==== * {{sense|yes}} {{l|de|jawohl}} ====Antonyms==== * {{sense|yes}} {{l|de|nein}} ===Further reading=== * {{R:Duden}} {{catlangname|de|modal particles|phrasebook}} ---- ==Gothic== ===Romanization=== {{got-rom}} # {{romanization of|got|êåæêå∞}} ---- ==Guerrero Amuzgo== ===Adjective=== {{head|amu|adjective}} # [[heavy]] ===Pronoun=== {{head|amu|pronoun}} # [[I]] ---- ==Gutnish== ===Pronunciation=== * {{IPA|gmq-gut|/jaÀê/|[j…ëÀê]}} ===Etymology 1=== From {{inh|gmq-gut|non|ek}}.
